result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A Schuster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas A Schuster is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas A Schuster was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Nicholas A Schuster was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas A Schuster

records.addlTxt:
[MK] cases #21CM457 and #22CF20 called at 11:04am 
Defendant Nicholas A Schuster in court with Attorney John Dade. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
As to Case #22CF20:  Attorney Dade agrees that probable cause exists in the four corners of the Criminal Complaint.
Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; pleas of " No Contest " are entered in case #21CM457-Count #1, and in case #22CF20-Counts #3 and #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the pleas, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #21CM457-Count #2 and Case #22CF20-Count #2. Further the Court dismisses Case #22CF20- Count #1 outright, without prejudice.

In case #21CM457-Count #1, and in case #22CF20-Counts #3 and #4 each, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for two years with conditions:
--in case #21CM457-Count #1 only:  to serve a term in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, from November 23rd, 2022 at 12:00pm to March 21, 2023. The Court allows for the transfer of the service of this jail term to another county jail conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring or other passive service.  Mr. Schuster is required to report for commencement and service of jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--mental health assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--no contact with KNM unless KNM and the Agent agree
--to complete a parenting class of some kind per Agent 
--not to discipline any child-- not by physical discipline or discipline of any manner 
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational programming per Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no alcohol, no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, to take all prescription medications only as prescribed
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--to pay costs, fees, surcharges [clerk: apply posted $650 Cash Bond funds toward payment of court financial obligations] 

As to case #21CM457-Days credit for time already served:  3 days
As to case #22CF20-Days credit for time already served:  2 days
recess 11:38am

Waiver of Prelim on June 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[MK] case called at 12:12pm 
Defendant Nicholas A Schuster in court with Attorney John Dade. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Asst. Corporation Counsel Whitney DeVoe appears for the Public as to a related Childrens Court matter. 
On agreement of counsel the Court amends the condition of Bond that prohibits contact with Victim 2 to have an exception that Mr. Schuster is allowed to have supervised visits with his son [the child's initials and date of birth were recited by the Court but not included herein] as approved by Jefferson County Human Services and as provided for by Orders in Jefferson County Case #22JC1.

[ml] Cases 21CM457 and 22CF20 called at 2:00PM
Defendant Nicholas A Schuster appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Attorney Amber Rumpf (Def does not qualify). ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
ADA Teuber verifies Victim Rights Compliance.

The Defendant provides an updated mailing address: 4 S 5th St, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538.

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court sets this matter over for Adjourned Initial Appearance. The Court tolls any pending time limits and preserves all the Defendant's jurisdictional and constitutional objections.

In 21CM457:
The Court requires a $650.00 Cash Bond (already posted) with conditions:
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Victim 1

In 22CF20:
The Court requires a $5,000.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no contact with Victim 1 or Victim 2
--no presence at the Victims' residence or any location they temporarily occupy; the Defendant may return the residence one time with the accompaniment of a Law Enforcement Officer to retrieve what is personally and legally his, any items in dispute shall be left at the residence and shall be subject to the civil and family court process
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription


recess 2:13PM

NEXT: BOTH FILES: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 02/03 at 10:00AM via Zoom
